page.title: 09Places of interest
page.content: There are many interesting places in the area such as Lea Hall, Ongars (both of which are mentioned in the original Domesday Book), Colville Hall and Corringales. It is said that Robert the Bruce was born in a ditch outside Corringales and later in his life came back and stayed the night. Near to Mill Cottage there was a windmill which was pulled down in 1906. All the villagers used to bring their grain here as did the people from Sheering, Hallingbury and Hatfield Broad Oak. In the garden of Mill Cottage is a well which is forty feet deep. There is an abattoir which is one of the biggest in the country. Down Hall is a large hotel situated in quiet countryside and caters for conferences and banquets. Other notable places of interest will be found on other pages.
